Best of 2015

31 Dec 2015 tagged in 2015, best of, fiction, nonfiction, performances, posts

 

A summary of books, films, and other media produced, consumed, and enjoyed this year by me:

Best Non-Fiction Read for the First Time: 

  • Sons of Providence by Charles Rappleye
  • In the Heart of the Sea by Nathaniel Philbrick
  • Fun Home by Alison Bechdel
  • Closer to Freedom by Stephanie Camp
  • The Race Beat by Gene Roberts and Hank Klibanoff

Best Fiction Read for the First Time: 

  • The Song of Achilles by Madeline Miller
  • Station Eleven by Emily St. John Mandel
  • Americanah by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
  • The Blind Assassin by Margaret Atwood

Best TV/Movies watched for the First Time: 

  • West Wing (1999-2006)
  • Parks and Recreation (2009-2015)
  • House of Cards (2013 – )

  • Jessica Jones (2015 – )

  • Selma (2014)
  • Thelma and Louise (1991)
  • Star Wars: The Force Awakens (2015)

Best Performances:

  • Welcome to Night Vale’s “The Investigators” @ Berklee Performance Center – May 20
  • Newsies @ Boston Opera House – July 2
  • Kinky Boots @ Boston Opera House – August 19
  • The Book of Mormon @ Emerson Colonial Theatre – October 11
  • The Wiz @ NBC – December 4
  • *Honorary Mention: Sydney Lucas’s performance at the Tony’s 

Best Posts or Articles By Other People Published This Year: 

  • “Public history and public libraries: a natural affinity” by Jeff Manuel
  • “Waiting by the light: One artist’s account of riding the T” by Kate Gilbert
  • “Hamilton, Art, History, and Truth” by Joseph M. Adelman
  • “An Undergraduate’s Love Letter to Digital Humanities Research” by Tiffany Chan
  • “I used to lead tours at a plantation. You won’t believe the questions I got about slavery.” by Margaret Biser

Best Posts By Me: 

  • At Past @ Present: Closing the Gap: Frequently Asked Questions at the John Brown House Museum
  • On this blog: On My 20th Listen to Hamilton
  • At UMass CHC: A Moral Voyage: The Binder
  • At Five College Digital Humanities: Museum of Forbidden Technologies
  • At UMass New Media: What I Learned About Myself in English 302

Cool things that happened this year, not mentioned elsewhere in this post: 

  • I visited some cool museums – the Museum of Anthropology at the University of British Columbia, the Eiteljorg Museum of Indianapolis, and the Elms Mansion in Newport to name a few.
  • I mostly followed my New Year’s Resolutions.
  • I redesigned my website.
  • I officially started my thesis!!!

Recent Posts

  • Digital Second Edition of Judaica Americana 30 Jun 2020

  • The History of Quarantine (Broad Street Review) 10 Mar 2020

  • Illuminating Iranian Tradition (Broad Street Review) 13 Jan 2020
